page.title: 08Industry
page.content: There is a lot of fishing on Tiree.Many people collect whelks. Mr Oldfield buys whelks from people who collect them. Lots of people have got boats and they go fishing at night. People go down to the shore and collect mussels and take them home to eat. You put them in a pot, add some salt leave to boil for about half an hour, leave for ten minutes and eat.Early in the morning fishermen go out in their boats and check their creels to see if there are any lobsters in them. If there is not they will put more bait in the creels .They also go fishing for saithe.There are three people who go diving for clams- one of those people goes trawling for clams.
